Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the Gastric Financial Navigation Study?

A) It is a routine check-up program for general health maintenance.
B) It is a research study designed to evaluate the impact of a financial navigation program for cancer patients and their caregivers.
C) It is a commercial service offering financial advice to the general public.
D) It is a compulsory government audit of patient finances.

Correct answer: B) It is a research study designed to evaluate the impact of a financial navigation program for cancer patients and their caregivers.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary goal of the Pilot Randomized Study of a Proactive Financial Navigation Intervention in Patients With Newly Diagnosed Gastric and Gastroesophageal Junction (GEJ) Adenocarcinoma?
A) To compare the effectiveness of different chemotherapy treatments for gastric cancer; B) To assess the impact of a financial navigation program on patients' understanding of cancer care costs and their ability to access financial resources; C) To determine the best surgical procedures for patients with gastric and GEJ cancer; D) To evaluate the psychological impact of cancer diagnosis on patients and caregivers.

Correct answer: B

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How long is the expected duration of participation for subjects in the Pilot Randomized Study of a Proactive Financial Navigation Intervention?
A) 1 month; B) 3 months; C) 6 months; D) 12 months
Correct answer: C) 6 months

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
What does the new consent form indicate about any additional costs you may incur as a result of participating in the study?
A) Participants will have to pay for the financial counseling sessions.
B) Participants will be charged for the assistance from the Patient Advocate Foundation.
C) There are no additional costs for participating in the study.
D) Participants will need to purchase the educational videos provided in the study.

Correct answer: C) There are no additional costs for participating in the study.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
What will happen if you agree to participate in the financial navigation program study for patients with newly diagnosed gastric and GEJ adenocarcinoma?
A) You will be automatically assigned to the intervention group.
B) You will be required to attend in-person financial counseling sessions weekly.
C) You will be randomly assigned to either the intervention group or the usual care group with a 50% chance for each.
D) You will receive a series of 12 monthly phone calls from the study team.

Correct answer: C) You will be randomly assigned to either the intervention group or the usual care group with a 50% chance for each.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What will happen if you choose to withdraw from the Pilot Randomized Study of a Proactive Financial Navigation Intervention after consenting to participate?
A) You will be required to pay for any services received during the study; B) You will lose access to your regular medical care; C) Your survey results and information will remain in the study records and cannot be removed; D) You will be obligated to continue the study activities until completion.

Correct answer: C

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants, including patients and caregivers, will be enrolled in the financial navigation study?
A) 20; B) 40; C) 60; D) 80

Correct answer: C) 60

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
What are the potential risks or discomforts associated with participating in the Gastric Financial Navigation Study?
A) Physical side effects from medical treatments; B) Emotional distress from discussing sensitive financial information; C) Time commitment for monthly phone calls; D) Risk of not receiving any medical care during the study

Correct answer: B) Emotional distress from discussing sensitive financial information

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
What are the potential benefits of participating in the financial navigation program for cancer patients and their caregivers as described in the study?
A) Guaranteed financial compensation for medical expenses
B) Assistance in understanding and managing cancer care costs and accessing resources
C) Provision of a permanent financial advisor for all future healthcare needs
D) Immediate debt forgiveness for all cancer-related expenses

Correct answer: B) Assistance in understanding and managing cancer care costs and accessing resources

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes how your personal information will be handled in the Gastric Financial Navigation Study?
A) Your personal information will be shared publicly to promote the study.
B) Your personal information will be kept confidential and only accessed by authorized study team members and specific partners mentioned in the consent form.
C) Your personal information will be used for marketing purposes unrelated to the study.
D) All your financial information will be accessible to any staff member at the Seattle Cancer Care Alliance without restrictions.

Correct answer: B

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
What does the consent form state about compensation if a participant is injured as a result of taking part in the study?
A) Participants will receive financial compensation for injuries directly related to the study.
B) Participants will receive free medical treatment for injuries directly related to the study.
C) The consent form does not provide information about compensation for injuries.
D) Participants will receive a gift card as compensation for injuries.

Correct answer: C) The consent form does not provide information about compensation for injuries.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject

A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What does the consent form state about your ability to decline participation in the study?

A) Declining to participate will result in a loss of medical benefits.
B) Participation is mandatory once you agree to join the study.
C) You may refuse to participate or withdraw at any time without any penalty or loss of benefits you are entitled to.
D) You will incur additional costs if you decide not to participate.

Correct answer: C) You may refuse to participate or withdraw at any time without any penalty or loss of benefits you are entitled to.
